HighlightRegistry.summary:
The HighlightRegistry interface of the CSS Custom Highlight API is used to register objects to be styled using the API.
It is accessed via .

remarks.para: A HighlightRegistry instance is a Map-like object, in which each key is the name string for a custom highlight, and the corresponding value is the associated object.

HighlightRegistryClear.summary: The clear() method of the interface removes all the objects registered in the HighlightRegistry.

remarks.para: HighlightRegistry is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightRegistryDelete.summary: The delete() method of the interface removes a the named object from the HighlightRegistry.

remarks.para: HighlightRegistry is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightRegistryDelete.returns: Returns true if a Highlight object under the provided name was in the HighlightRegistry; otherwise false.

HighlightRegistryEntries.summary: The entries() method of the interface returns a new Iterator object that contains the [name, highlight] pairs for each element in the HighlightRegistry object, in insertion order.

remarks.para: HighlightRegistry is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightRegistryEntries.returns: A new iterator object that contains an array of [name, highlight] for each Highlight object in the HighlightRegistry, in insertion order.

HighlightRegistryForEach.summary: The forEach() method of the interface executes a provided function once for each object in the registry, in insertion order.

remarks.para: HighlightRegistry is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightRegistryGet.summary: The get() method of the interface returns the named object from the registry.

remarks.para: HighlightRegistry is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightRegistryGet.returns: The Highlight object associated with the specified name, or if the name can't be found in the HighlightRegistry.

HighlightRegistryHas.summary: The has() method of the interface returns a boolean indicating whether or not a object with the specified name exists in the registry.

remarks.para: HighlightRegistry is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightRegistryHas.returns: Returns true if a highlight with the specified name exists in the registry; otherwise false.

HighlightRegistryHighlightsFromPoint.summary: NOTE Experimental The highlightsFromPoint() method of the interface returns an array of objects representing the custom highlights applied at a specific point within the viewport.

remarks.para:
-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS custom highlight API module

HighlightRegistryHighlightsFromPoint.returns: An array of HighlightHitResult objects representing the custom highlights applied at the point in the viewport specified by the x and y parameters.Each HighlightHitResult object contains the following properties:If no custom highlights are applied at the specified point, or the specified point is outside the viewport, the method returns an empty array.Now that we have the ability to create and apply custom highlights, we can use the highlightsFromPoint() method to return the custom highlights applied at a specific point.We grab a reference to our <section> element, then define a dblclick event handler function to handle outputting the highlighted text at the mouse cursor position when the event fires. Inside the handler we pass the current mouse coordinates into a highlightsFromPoint() call, clear the contents of the <section> element, then loop through each highlight in the highlights array.For each highlight, we grab the first range in the ranges array (there is only ever one range in each highlight, in this case), then get the exact highlighted string using and add it to the <section> element's innerHTML, inside an <article> element.

HighlightRegistryKeys.summary: The keys() method of the interface returns a new Iterator object that contains the keys for each Highlight object in the HighlightRegistry object in insertion order.

remarks.para: HighlightRegistry is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightRegistryKeys.returns: A new iterator object containing the names of each Highlight object in the registry, in insertion order.

HighlightRegistrySet.summary: The set() method of the interface adds or updates a object in the registry with the specified name.

remarks.para: HighlightRegistry is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

HighlightRegistrySize.summary: The size property returns the number of objects in the .

remarks.para:
-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightRegistrySize.value: A read-only integer indicating how many Highlight objects the registry contains.

HighlightRegistryValues.summary: The values() method of the interface returns a new Iterator object that contains the values for each Highlight object in the HighlightRegistry object in insertion order.

remarks.para: HighlightRegistry is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightRegistryValues.returns: A new iterator object containing each Highlight object in the registry, in insertion order.
